ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Students interested in learning about UN and international negotiations, this class is useful

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Attending UN meetings were very useful
Having an instructor with a great deal of experience in this field added to course content.

I learned so much from the trips to the UN. I also really liked the format of the class. The small class size allowed for a lot of discussion. It was great to hear my peers opinions on sustainable development, especially because we had such different backgrounds represented in the class.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: field trips and lecture
Classes need better organization

I might have liked more concrete readings. There were a couple of times when we were given a choice of various things to read, which was helpful, but it also made referencing the materials difficult in class because not everyone had read them.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Yes most of the time
Our visits to the United Nations helped illustrate many of the points taught in class.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: As a part of my work, i have to attend international conferences so it was useful

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: to understand function of UN
Get more insights on UN
Due to my interest in the UN and related subject matter.

I was interested in learning about how high level, global policies impact environmental management. I wanted to learn more about how the United Nations functions with respect to environmental conservation.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes it did meet my expectations
Yes
Yes, I learned a lot about how the United Nations works. I also have a much deeper understanding of the concept of sustainable development and how the concept is changing within the United Nations.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Different perspectives were interesting and beneficial

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Student wishing to get more insights on the UN that literature usually don't provide, this is a must course.
Students interested in the subject matter
It is important to take as many trips to the United Nations as are offered. I learned so much from the field trips.
